content.prompt: In the mid-twentieth century, the presence of Chinese and Japanese populations in North America and of South Asian populations in the Caribbean and South Africa is best explained by which of the following?

choices.label: Trade networks of the seventeenth and eighteenth centuries
European and United States imperial conquests of the seventeenth and eighteenth centuries
Refugees fleeing warfare and repressive regimes during the twentieth century

topic.text: 6.6: Causes of Migration in an Interconnected World

skill.text: Skill 5.B: Explain how a historical development or process relates to another historical development or process.
